Others: Joel Embiid made his season debut against the New York Knicks after a three-week layoff due to a left knee injury and a suspension.
Embiid struggled in his return, scoring 13 points on 2-for-11 shooting and showing signs of rust, particularly in his jumper and face-up game.
The 76ers lost to the Knicks 111-99, with the Knicks' Karl-Anthony Towns performing well with 21 points, 13 rebounds, and 6 assists.
The 76ers are prioritizing the health of their veteran stars, including Embiid, Paul George, and Tyrese Maxey, over immediate success.
The Knicks have had the same starting lineup for their 10 games, indicating better continuity compared to the 76ers.
Embiid plans to play against the Cavaliers on Wednesday, despite previously stating he would never play back-to-back games.
